render.tex: \title{Identifying differential equation type} Is it ordinary, homogenous or first-order linear

reason.tex:
%text At school level, you will be asked to solve only the following types of differential equations % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{cN}
\hline \text{Type} & \text{Looks like} \\ \hline \text{Ordinary} & \dydx = g(x)\cdot h(y) \\ \hline \text{Homogenous} & \dydx = f \left(\frac{y}{x} \right) \\ \hline \text{First order linear} & \dydx + P(x)\cdot y = Q(x) \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text Notice that all of the above differential equations have \underline\text{order one and degree one} Each of the above equations has a different technique for solving it. Hence, one must first identify the type of the differential equation%
